questions.answer_description:
VMware Tools heartbeat, used for simple verification
Reference: http://blogs.vmware.com/vsphere/files/2013/12/ABV_technical_white_paper.pdf
questions.question_text: After creating virtual machine backups using vSphere Data Protection, you decide to perform a simple verification of those backups. Which feature will you use for this?
VMware vSphere 6.x empowers users with which two capabilities? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A. Provide advanced availability protection.
B. Virtualize scale-up and scale-out applications.

questions.answer_description:
vSphere empowers users to virtualize scale-up and scale-out applications with confidence, redefines availability, and simplifies the virtual data center.
Reference: http://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere

questions.question_text: Which storage protocol allows administrators to reduce the total number of network ports used in the network environment?

discussion.content: There is another similar question, but is about "characteristic" not protocol. That could be Virtual SAN.

comments.content:
A) The right answer is "A" Fibre Channel over Ethernet because: "A converged network based on FCoE lowers the number of cables, switch ports and adapters required to maintain both SAN and LAN connectivity."

https://www.vmware.com/content/dam/digitalmarketing/vmware/en/pdf/techpaper/Converged_Networking_with_Emulex_FCoE_Adapters_and_VMware_ESX_v15.pdf

questions.answer_description: FCoE: The Fibre Channel traffic is encapsulated into Fibre Channel over Ethernet (FCoE) frames. These FCoE frames are converged with other types of traffic on the Ethernet network. By carrying both Ethernet and Fibre Channel traffic on the same Ethernet link, the utilization of the physical infrastructure has greatly increased. FCoE also reduces the total number of network ports and cabling.

discussion.content:
A) Resource pools with VMware DRS. Aggregate disparate hardware resources into unified logical resource pools. With VMware DRS, resource pools are automatically and intelligently optimized to ensure that IT resource allocation matches business priorities while maximizing hardware utilization. 
B) Resources are allocated to the virtual machine by either migrating it to another server with more available resources or by making more “space” for it on the same server by migrating other virtual machines to different servers

https://www.vmware.com/pdf/drs_datasheet.pdf

B. Allocates available resources among the virtual machines.
C. Consolidates workloads to reduce the power consumed by the cluster.

questions.question_text: What are two features of a resource pool? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Allocates available resources among the virtual machines.
choices.A: Controls the aggregate CPU and memory resources of the DRS cluster.
choices.C: Consolidates workloads to reduce the power consumed by the cluster.

discussion.content:
A. DRS
B. vMotion
C. vRealize Operations

questions.question_text: Which three vSphere 6.x features allow an administrator to perform effective resource management? (Choose three.)
